latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.title: Fair BEER Act

item.name: Introduced in House
item.text:
Fair Brewers Excise and Economic Relief Act or the Fair BEER Act

This bill amends the Internal Revenue Code to revise the excise tax on beer brewed or produced, and removed for consumption or sale, within the United States or imported into the United States. The revised tax ranges from $0 for an amount not exceeding 7,143 barrels to $18 per barrel on an amount exceeding 2 million barrels.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. WOMACK:H.R. 767.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8[Page H856]

item.title: Fair Brewers Excise and Economic Relief Act
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to reform and reset the excise tax on beer, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
